channel.title: Blogs on Oberlin Motion Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Oberlin Motion Lab

item.title: text
item.description: When $a \ne 0$, there are two solutions to \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\) and they are $$x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a}.$$

item.title: Welcome to OML
